text: Heer Ranjha is a famous sad, love story from the Punjab .A. Tahir, 'Punjabi Folk tales' Lahore, 1992 Other Punjabi love stories are Mirza Sahiban, and Sohni Mahiwal. Inter-caste Rivalry The story is about two lovers, Heer a beautiful girl from a rich Sial also labelled as _Siyal clan of Jats_ and noble family; and Ranjha belonging to a wealthy clan of Ranjhas . They both fell in love but Heer's parents were against their marriage. Heer was married by force to a rich young man. Ranjha, very saddened by this, became a hermit He later tried to meet Heer but he failed, and they both died in the mulberry tree near the tree they used to make love This story has been written by different writers, at different times. The best and most famous is Heer by the poet Waris Shah written in 1761.Tahir, aa p.78 Some films in Punjabi language and Urdu have also been made about this story. The story is still very popular today. Many young girls and boys who fall in love have to face the same problemsDr ST Mirza 'Resistance themes in Punjabi Literature' Lahore, 1991. Some people believe that there were two real young lovers called Heer and Ranjha, long ago. They say that they died and were buried together in a tomb near Jhang, in Punjab.Mirza And Yes it is a real story but the plot may vary due to many factors. ==References== Category:Folklore Category:Pakistani literature Category:Pakistani folklore
